s9.message: On start — the subscription is automatically refreshed when you start Adblock Plus.

s3.message: Adblock Plus will run as background service and display its status in notification area.

s2.message: Adblock Plus will automatically select a suitable filter subscription for you the first time it runs. You can still select any other subscription from the list.

s7.message: Manually — the subscription is only refreshed when you press the refresh button (

s6.message:
Each time you select a different subscription, it is automatically downloaded and activated.
By default, subscriptions are being refreshed periodically. There are two other options available in the advanced settings:

s5.message: You can change subscription at any time by selecting it from a list:

s19.message: In opened dialog mark Show advanced options check box:

s18.message: Connect to the desired network (access point) if not already. Long press on connected network, context menu will appear. Select Modify network config:

s12.message: Depending on the device, the proxy settings are in different places. If your device is in the following list, follow the specific instructions:

s11.message:
Android versions prior to 3.1 do not have proxy settings built-in, but several manufacturers have added them to their devices.
If you have a non-rooted device running an earlier Android version than 3.1, you can still set up the proxy manually.

s17.message: Run Settings application. Select Wi-Fi. The list of available Wi-Fi networks will open:

s16.message: Android 4.x (Ice Cream Sandwich, Jelly Bean, KitKat) devices

s15.message: If your device isn't in the list, the most common place for the proxy settings is in the advanced WiFi settings.

s23.message: Go to the WiFi settings and select Advanced settings from the menu:

s20.message: Scroll to proxy settings, select Manual, proxy options will appear:

s21.message: Set Proxy to {1} and Port to the number specified by Adblock Plus in the notification message:

s24.message: Find the proxy host and port settings:

s25.message: Set the proxy host to {1} and port to the number displayed by Adblock Plus:
